body.name: LG Xpression C410 Qwerty Keyboard Slider Cellphone GSM Unlocked - Blue
body.stockDetail: Only 2 left in stock - order soon.
features: DOES THIS DEVICE NEED A SIM CARD: Yes it does Being that this device is GSM unlocked it will work on any GSM Network with an activated Standard size SIM Card (Not-included), Generally complimentary when activating an account card.

WHAT NETWORK FREQUENCIES ARE SUPPORTED BY THIS DEVICE: GSM HSPA 2G bands GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 3G bands HSDPA 850 / 1900 With Speed on HSPA of 3.6 download and 0.384 Upload Mbps, which give it the ability to roam in many foreign countries

HOW LONG CAN I EXPECT THE BATTERY TO LAST ME: Well the battery has 1000mAh which in a Usage time frame means 3.5 solid hours of Talktime as well it has a Standby time of up to 340 hours before you need to recharge the battery

TELL ME WHAT SOLID SPECKS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS DEVICE: Well it has a 230Mhz Single-Core Qualcomm QSC6270E CPU processor With an Internal storage of 256MB (63MB available to user) and External storage Until 32GB, as well as a 3" color display and only weighs (4.59 ounces).

WHAT DOES UNLOCKED REALLY MEAN: Unlocked devices are compatible with GSM carriers the kinds that Use SIM Cards for Service like AT&T and T-Mobile as well as with GSM SIM cards (e.g. H20, Straight Talk, and select prepaid carriers) Unlocked Devices will not work with CDMA Carriers the kinds that don't use sim cards for service like Sprint, Verizon, Boost or Virgin
body.description: The LG Xpression C410 is a messaging cell phone featuring a slide-out QWERTY keyboard and multimedia features such as a 2-megapixel camera with video recording, multi-format music player, Bluetooth compatibility, and microSD slot for additional storage. This quad-band GSM phone is also equipped with WCDMA for international use, 3G data, GPS, and support for multiple languages including Spanish, French, and Korean. The Xpression is a very capable feature phone with excellent sound quality.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 3.6 3.6 out of 5 stars 160 ratings 3.6 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great basic phone.
reviews.reviewText: Love this! Bought it for my 10 year old. Took it to my carrier...Cricket. They inserted a sim card and it worked beautiful. The guy at cricket did something in settings..not sure if that did it or not. But he said he put it on "text only" this disabled the internet. Either way I did not want my 10 y.o. to have internet and whatever he did...it worked. My dtr is able to call, text, take pics and text them. We haven't tried uploading music from our computer yet, but that will be next. For her little use, the battery lasts a long time. Great phone for anyone like me who wants access to your kid without the worry of the internet. Hope this helps. Oh, and she LOVES the keyboard feature.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Does not work with AT&T
reviews.reviewText: This specifically says AT&T but it is not a compatible device. Wouldn't work for T-Mobile or Consumer Cellular which also use GSM unlocked phones.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Clunky, proprietary OS makes this phone a pain to use.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this phone for my mother who had trouble adapting to her new touch screen only Android smartphone. She really missed her physical qwerty keyboard, and only uses her phone for texting and voice calls. This was the only phone, other than a Blackberry, that had the required physical qwerty keyboard. It was a pain to transfer her contacts and photos (apparently she uses the camera too). The contacts had to be exported from the Android phone in a csv format. Then imported, INDIVIDUALLY, on this phone. It took about an hour to import her 260 contacts! When importing, this phone truncated the names, making some of them hard to identify. Camera quality is poor. The proprietary OS is clunky and going between the touch screen and physical keyboard to do things is far from intuitive or even natural. I think mom will adapt, but don't think she is very happy with this phone. Maybe i'll check out a blackberry for her.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for talking and texting
reviews.reviewText: Ordered the phone for my mom because hers finally died. She does not need a smart phone and only calls or texts so I needed something with a keypad. It’s hard to find simple phones like this and I remember when they were really inexpensive. Had AT&T put a new SIM card in it and I charged it to make sure it works before mailing it to her. It worked fine and I hope it stays working. To all of you that are not phone savvy be-careful with your phone purchase online some are no longer compatible with 4G and you will end up returning the phone. This one was good to go but I almost went with a different phone that I now know would of been garbage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Keys are small - Yet it's a geek's dream come true!
reviews.reviewText: Four stars and here's why: Unfortunately, the keys on this phone are quite small for some adult fingers. It was difficult to tell from the picture, but I had to try it out, nevertheless. Perhaps this phone would fit a teenager's fingers? The main reason I wanted to have this phone was for the actual keyboard instead of a touch screen keyboard. I returned this phone due to the small keyboard, so I honestly didn't bother with testing out the touch screen or picture quality features. The actual phone was very comfortable (except for the keyboard), compact, lightweight, but solidly constructed. My experience with LG phones have been excellent. They are built to last. My current phone is an LG. Slider phones are cool anyway. I guess it brings out the "geeky" side of my personality ;-)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works with Cricket Wireless!!
reviews.reviewText: This phone is unlocked. I have service with Cricket Wireless. My husband replaced his smart phone with this one. We had to purchase a standard size sim card, most of the smart phones have the nano size sims but after I purchased the correct size sim from walmart all it took was a 5 min chat with a cricket representative to switch over the sims and it has worked well every since. I chose this particular phone because my husband does have to text a lot with his job. My husband wears xl gloves "snuggly" and the keyboard fits his hands without any problems. He said he really likes the phone and no longer has all the other distractions that come with a smart phone!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Developed a screen problem after two weeks. Returned.
reviews.reviewText: I liked it well enough at first, although it was full of undeletable ATT bloatware. However, after two weeks, it developed a strange pixalation problem in the form of black dots and lines, like a tatoo across the screen. It was within the 30 day return window, so I sent it back, fearing the problem would get even worse over time.ProsSeemed well-made; nice size; good keyboard.ConsDeveloped a screen problem; was a pain to set up to send and receive picture texts; could not delete obnoxious ATT bloatware, including ATT addresses that popped up as the first 7 addresses in the contacts.Verdict: Always get things like this Fulfilled by Amazon to benefit from their great return policy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars ... for about 3 weeks now and I am very happy that I finally decided to buy this phone to ...
reviews.reviewText: I have this phone for about 3 weeks now and I am very happy that I finally decided to buy this phone to replace my old broken phone. This one seems to work perfectly and since it was unlocked I was able to just switch my old SIM card to this one and I had all my contacts saved and was able to keep my cheap plan and my number. I find it a bit harder to type on this one than on my old phone but that is probably just a matter of getting used to a new keyboard. The touch screen seems to work perfectly, which is something I was worried about. I will try to update if I have any problems later on.
Exactly what I wanted & expected. Thank you.

reviews.reviewTitle: and it is not as sturdy as I thought
reviews.reviewText: I was dissapointed that the phone does not have WIFI access, and it is not as sturdy as I thought. Fast shipping, no hassel!
